Lightning Launcher - Lightning Launcher - Add Group Delete Group Edit Group App Details - Hidden Old settings have been migrated
Edit Mode Change groups, add websites, and more. Only main window can edit Stop Editing
Close Launcher window after opening apps If enabled, Lightning Launcher will close itself when you open an app.
Use Quest Native Launching Launches apps with a method similar to the Quest's default launcher. 
Turning this off will change how windows are organized, and could cause issues.
Scaling Target size for icons/banners.
May vary with window size. Margins Target spacing between icons/banners.
May vary with window size.
VR Apps Phone Apps TV Apps Panel Apps Websites Use this as the default group for new: Below Icons Below Banners
Lightning Launcher Settings Customize Appearance Shortcuts Shortcuts Make Lightning Launcher easier to access. Download & Install Latest Update
Behavior Wallpaper & Style Icon Layout Display as Banner Display as Icon Always Show Names Advanced Settings Open Advanced Settings for More Options Interface Window Launching Extra Features Search Settings Backup & Restore Background Translucency Makes the background of Lightning Launcher translucent in passthrough. 

Prevents multiple Lightning Launcher windows from being open at once. Quest 3/3S Background Blur Adds a blur effect to the background when translucent.
 Only for Quest 3/3S. Launcher restarts on change. 

Does not apply to shortcuts' windows.
Dark Mode If on, labels will appear white on a dark background. Animated Gradient over Wallpaper Enable Groups Reset All Icons Reset Names Default Groups Refresh Icons
Long Press to Edit Hide Empty Groups Launch Apps in Own Window by Default Show Web Search Engines in Searches Show Hidden Apps in Searches Export Settings Import Settings Export Groupings Import Groupings Set Default Home to Enable 3rd-party Shortcuts Let Android apps add shortcut icons to Lightning Launcher.
Does not replace the App Library or home button.
Enable Additional Phone App Window Sizes Allows apps to be opened in different sized windows, may cause issues. New size options can be cycled in per-app settings
When this service is enabled, Lightning Launcher will open automatically when you hover the cursor over the App Library icon on the right of dock for about half a second.
(This may make it difficult to access the default launcher)
 
Make sure to enable the "Use Lightning Launcher" switch - the "Lightning Launcher Shortcut" switch won't do anything on the Quest!
Reset Icon Tune with Quest Game Tuner lets you adjust resolution, FPS, and more!
Launching 2D apps or websites in their own window allows for easier multitasking on Quest devices, but will cause certain apps to not always launch.

If you have any issues, disable this option! Launching 2D apps or websites in their own window allows for easier multitasking on Quest devices, but will cause certain apps to not always launch.
 
Setting custom window sizes will fix apps not launching, display some apps slightly clearer, and allow for different window sizes in the flat view. 
However, it may occasionally cause windows to get stuck or Lightning Launcher to crash.
 
All of these options can be set only on a per-app basis.
 
If you have issues, turn this option off and make sure any apps are not set to launch in their own windows. Reboot to fix stuck windows. Turning this option off will hide the top bar when not in Edit Mode. 
 
The settings button will also be hidden when not in Edit Mode.
 
Instead, press the back button, left-arrow at the top-left of the window, to open settings.
Setting Lightning Launcher as your default android home app will allow other apps to add shortcut icons to the home screen. 
This only needs to be done once.
 
It WILL NOT replace the actual default launcher on VR devices, and with not change the operation of Lightning Launcher itself.

 If you want to do that, check Set Up Shortcuts/Shortcut Settings for shortcuts TO Lightning Launcher.
For the best experience, you must install Lightning Browser to open websites in Lightning Launcher.
 
(Alternatively, you can try to change the browser in Settings -> Advanced Settings)
For the best experience, you must update Lightning Browser. = Open the website again after installation is complete
Websites in Lightning Launcher Easily Access Websites & Web Apps
Websites will appear as apps on your home screen. They will open in Lightning Browser (a separate app which you will be prompted to install).
 
You can also search Google, YouTube, or ApkPure using the search bar.
Audio in the Background
After being minimized, websites can continue running, and can play and record audio in the background - even while in a game! (You may experience latency or stutters in calls)
 
Websites open via a search will not run in the background unless added with the Add Page to Launcher (+) button.
Browser Selection
On Quest devices, you can select to launch in the Meta Quest browser, which supports VR web content. 

You can change you default browser in Settings -> Advanced Settings.
Add a Website Add a Website to the Launcher Enter Any Website URL Enter a valid URL This website is already in %1$s Added websites can play background audio Add to %s
Shortcuts Services Easily Access Lightning Launcher 
By enabling the shortcut service, Lighting Launcher will open when you hover over the chosen icon on the dock, basically replacing that app. 
 
 
Enabling the Shortcut Service 
 
1. Use the button to open Android's accessibility settings 
2. Select the service you wish to enable 
3. Switch the service on at the top of the page 
4. Click "Allow" on the prompt 
5. 'X' out of the window and enjoy!
Continue to Accessibility Settings
Important Info Cancel Got It! Confirm Continue
Open in Default Window Open in App's Own Window Open in Phone-Style Window Open in Small 4:3 Window Open in Medium-Size Window Open in Large 16:9 Window Open in Huge 16:9 Window Open in Wide 21:9 Window
Default for Websites: Open in Lightning Browser Open in Meta Quest Browser Try to Open in System Default
Turn On Edit Mode Turn Off Edit Mode
Click an app to select it or click here to select all 1 app selected, click a group to move it %d apps selected, click a group to move them Moved an app to %s Moved %d apps to %s Cleared selection Selected all visible apps
An update is available! You can update from version %1$s to %2$s, fully on-device. Continue Skip this Update Skipped version
Downloading Latest Version of %s You should get a prompt to install shortly.
 
If you accidentally dismissed it, didn't give permission, or got an error, you can try again from settings. Hide
Failed to download package! Make sure you have a good internet connection and try again later.
Skip updating to version %1$s? You will not be notified about this update again.
 
Keep in mind that updates are highly recommended and may include important fixes.
 
If you are avoiding this update because it causes issues, report your issues at github.com/threethan/Lightning Launcher
 
You can still update later from the settings! I Understand, Skip It Just Dismiss
Saved configuration to Importing, please wait… Error while copying file! Imported configuration, the launcher must now close!
Default Group Settings Current Default Groups:

 
%1$s
 
You can change these by editing a group in edit mode. 
What would you like to do now?
Reset All Groups & Sort to Default Move everything to its Default Group Go Back, Don't do Anything Reset groups fully! Apps have been moved to your selected default groups
Set another group as default to unset this one
Icon Update/Clear Settings Lightning Launcher caches icons and banners for apps for faster loading.
 
You can clear this cache to refresh any icons which might have changed. Lightning Launcher will download icons for official Quest Games and app from the internet.
 
By clearing the icon cache, you can also redownload all such icons. This is useful if they seem to be missing! You can also set custom icons for apps by placing them in a folder ON THIS DEVICE, then pressing on the icon in the app info popup.
 
If you want, you can also clear all of these. Doing so will also clear the cache.
Clear Icon Cache Clear Custom Icons Go Back, Don't do Anything
Icon cache has been cleared All icons have been reset to default
Stop Running in the Background Launch App
About Adding Websites
Turn Off Edit Mode Select/Deselect All Visible Apps
Uninstall / Remove Uninstall / Remove All Selected Android App Info Change Icon
Backup All Settings & Groupings Restore All Settings & Groupings
Hide this App Un-Hide this App
Moved to Hidden Group Moved to Refreshing icon…
google.com youtube.com discord.com/app open.spotify.com listen.tidal.com apkmirror.com apkpure.com
Shortcuts Shortcut Options Shortcuts make it easier to open the launcher. 
It's highly recommended that you set up use at least one. Unfortunately, Android TV limits the functionality of accessibility services and third-party launchers. Return to Settings
Android TV Launcher Manager Install a third-party application which may allow you to change the default home on Android TV. 
This requires ADB Debugging to be enabled, and may not work on every device. 
 
If it doesn't install through here, look up "Android TV Launcher Manager XDA", then manually download & install.
Or… Just Use the Back Button! If you just use the back button on your remote, instead of the home button, you will always come back to Lightning Launcher. 
 
Pressing back once you get to the launcher will just toggle edit mode, keeping you from accidentally returning to the default launcher.
You must manually activate each redirect individually. 
Lighting Launcher will open alongside the target app. 
 Each shortcut can be used for another window of Lighting Launcher, even without activating it.
Add Lightning Launcher to the Dock Adding Lightning Launcher to the dock Remove an existing icon 
 
The dock only has 5 spaces. By default, they are all filled up. 
 
1. Close the app you want to remove (Camera or Quest Browser) 
2. Click and hold on the icon you want to remove; drag it slowly downwards until it says "Unpin" 
3. Release the icon 
 
You can't remove the Horizon Feed, Store, or People icons normally. 
 
 
Add Lightning Launcher 
 
1. Find Lightning Launcher in the recent apps at the right side of the dock 
2. Drag the Lightning Launcher icon to the left side of the dock 
3. Release the icon to place it in your choice of spot 
 
You can do this with any app. You can use the shortcuts to get differently colored icons for Lightning Launcher.
Feed Shortcut Install then activate to open Lightning Launcher when you press the Horizon Feed button on the dock.
Library Shortcut Install then activate to open Lightning Launcher when you press the App Library button on the dock. 
(This makes it hard to open the quest's app library) Store Shortcut Install then activate to open Lightning Launcher when you press the Store button on the dock. 
(This makes it hard to open the quest's store) People Shortcut Install then activate to open Lightning Launcher when you press the People button on the dock. 
(This makes it hard to open the quest's people app)
Install Update Activate Launch Deactivate Uninstall Installing… Installed Successfully
Please install an app which can pick images! Meta has broken Android's built-in file manager on your OS version, so you need to use a third-party app to browse file and select images. 

You are suggested to use the free Amaze file manager, which you can install now. 

After installation completes, try this action again. No installed app can pick images!
